title.narrative: OUTPUT 3: EBOLA / Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IPC - PREVENTIONAND RESPONSE

description.narrative: EBOLA / Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IPC - PREVENTIONAND RESPONSE, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The transmission of Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) in North Kivu and Ituri Provinces is interrupted and its spread to other provinces of the DRC and neighbouring countries, prevented

title.narrative: EBOLA / WASH IPC - PREVENTIONAND RESPONSE

description.narrative: 2021 was marked by two resurgences of EVD in North Kivu (Butembo in February and Beni in October).During these resurgences, UNICEF, as Co-lead of the IPC/WASH Commission with t WHO and MoH, played an important role in the response through its support for the decontamination (26 households and 41 health facilities). UNICEF and partners also supported WASH interventions in 189 health facilities. UNICEF also carried out interventions in schools reaching 12,034 students. At the community level, UNICEF helped to improve access to drinking water for 90,971 people, including 47,305 children, and organized hygiene promotion campaigns reaching 247,720 people.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
